result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm. / Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Waushara Cty Jail)

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant DANIEL C DAYE in custody and not in court.  Attorney Daniel G. Mitchell in court for DANIEL C DAYE.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Mitchell states the defendant has a much more serious case in Waushara County and requests a plea date. Court sets for Plea & sentencing on November 8, 2022 at 3:00 PM. Will be via zoom unless request for writ.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

8:45 AM Defendant DANIEL C DAYE appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel G. Mitchell appeared by video for DANIEL C DAYE.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy to Atty Mitchell. Attorney Mitchell acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Mitchell enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 8:48 AM
Return date scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

REFUSED to sign - Bail/Bond $500 signature bond & Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.
(Atty Daniel Mitchell)
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am. / Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Waushara Co Jail)
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

8:55 AM Defendant DANIEL C DAYE appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Statement by defendant has been waiting for 66 days for counsel. Defendant requests to proceed without counsel for the initial appearance. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  ADA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Defendant requests to appear via zoom.

Court adjourned at 8:59 AM

Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on June 14, 2022 at 8:30 AM.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report (Defendant is eligible for SPD, no attorney at this time.)
Public Records Request Response (submitted by the defendant's father, Curtis Daye).
Adjourned initial appearance on May 31, 2022 at 08:45 am. / Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Waushara County Jail)

1:15 PM Defendant DANIEL C DAYE appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Statement by defendant, received a letter from Atty Zilles and will no longer represent the defendant. Court instructs the defendant to contact the FDL Public Defender's office. Statement by defendant. Statement by Defendant's father - Curtis Daye. Court sets for Adjourned initial Appearance on May 31, 2022 at 8:45 AM

Court adjourned at 1:19 PM
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report - is eligible for SPD services, with no counsel at this time
Adjourned initial appearance on April 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm. / Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Waushara Cty Jail)

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant DANIEL C DAYE appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is looking for an attorney. The public defender's office hasn't been able to appoint an attorney yet. Defendant would like to adjourn until he can get an attorney. Court schedules adjourned initial appearance for April 26, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
